<<<<<<< HEAD
Brightmans predictions and prophecies vvritten 46 yeares since : concerning the three churches of Germanie, England, and Scotland : fore-telling the miserie of Germanie, the fall of the pride of bishops in England by the assistance of the Scottish Kirk : all which should happen, as he foretold, between the yeares of 36 and 41, &c. Brightman, Thomas, 1562-1607. Apocalypsis Apocalypseos. Brightman, Thomas, 1562-1607. Judgement or prophesies, what shall befall Germany, Scotland, Holland, and the churches adhering to them.
8 p.
s.n.], [S.l. : 1641.
A free epitome in prose and verse, with interpolations of Thomas Brightman's "Apocalypsis Apocalypseos" 1609, chapters 3-4. This is a different work from "Reverend Mr. Brightmans iudgement or prophesies" 1641, and "An epitome of Mr. Brightman his exposition upon the Revelation" 1644. Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
=======

Brightman, Thomas, 1562-1607. Apocalypsis Apocalypseos. Brightman, Thomas, 1562-1607. Judgement or prophesies, what shall befall Germany, Scotland, Holland, and the churches adhering to them.
8 p.
